pcanvas
Class Circle3D

java.lang.Object
  pcanvas.Circle3D

public class Circle3D
extends java.lang.Object

Basic 3D circle. Uses an axis of rotation in order to compute an accurate representation of the circle.

Field Summary
 Vector axis
          This circle's axis of rotation.
 Point center
          Center of the circle.
 java.util.List<Point> points
          Points on this circle.

          The circle's radius.

          Creates a circles from a center, an axis of rotation and a radius.
 
Method Summary
private  java.util.List<Point> computePointsFromRadius(float radius)

Constructor Detail

Circle3D

public Circle3D(Point center,
                Vector axis,
                float radius)
Creates a circles from a center, an axis of rotation and a radius. The default precision (number of points which make up the circle) value is 20.

Parameters:
center - center of the circle.
axis - circle's axis of rotation.
radius - radius of the circle.

Circle3D

public Circle3D(Point center,
                Vector axis,
                float radius,
                int precision)
Creates a circles from a center, an axis of rotation and a radius. The default precision (number of points which make up the circle) value is 20.

Parameters:
center - center of the circle.
axis - circle's axis of rotation.
radius - radius of the circle.
precision - the number of points on this circle.
Method Detail

computePointsWithPrecision

private java.util.List<Point> computePointsWithPrecision(float radius,
                                                         int precision)
Basic circle point computation. Uses a radius and a precision.

Parameters:
radius - the radius of the circle.
precision - the number of points on the circle.
Returns:
the generated circle points.

computePointsFromRadius

private java.util.List<Point> computePointsFromRadius(float radius)
Same as computePointsWithPrecision(float, int) -- defaults precision to 20.

Parameters:
radius - the radius of this circle.
Returns:
the generated circle points.
